details.description:
Yeezy expanded their 380 line with a new colorway in the Yeezy Boost 380 Onyx. Unlike 2020’s earlier releases like the Yeezy 380 Mist and Pepper, the Onyx colorway is the first 380 to feature primarily black and dark brown uppers.

The Yeezy 380 Onyx features a black and dark brown camo-print Primeknit upper with a flat black side spot. Similar to past colorways, a dark translucent BOOST sole delivers the ultimate cushioning experience that is primed to keep your feet fresh with style.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Onyx released in November of 2020 for $230.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Yecoraite Reflective is an iteration of the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 in a ‘Yecoraite Reflective’ colorway. 

This sneaker features a Primeknit upper dressed in a camo-like colorway with Off-White and Neutral Grey accents. Other details include an opening with a sock-like build, a Pale Orange, a post-dyed monofilament side stripe, decorative rope laces, and ‘adidas x YEEZY’ branding on the insole. The upper rests on a full-length BOOST midsole covered by a salmon-like semi-translucent rubber and an orange gum-hued rubber outsole with herringbone traction patterns. 

What our experts love about this adidas Yeezy Boost 380 is its design and comfort. A futuristic design with a camo-like upper dressed in orange, Natural Grey, and white hues give this sneaker a stylish look. The Primeknit upper, a full-length Boost midsole, and a unique lacing system guarantee comfort. The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Yecoraite Reflective was released on January 16, 2021 retailing at $250.

Yeezy added a new colorway to its 380 line with the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Covellite. The Covellite has one of the most interesting arrangements of color in its product line.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Covellite features a marbled navy blue, grey, and black Primeknit upper that is reminiscent of a digital camo pattern. A gum brown Boost sole with tubular black laces wraps up the design.
The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Covellite released in March of 2021 and retailed for $230.

Yeezy expanded their 380 line with the Yeezy Boost 380 Pepper, now available on StockX. The colorway is reminiscent of the Yeezy 380 Mist, only this time it trades darker hues for a light earth-toned look.

The Yeezy 380 Pepper features a light grey and blue Primeknit upper with a light brown side spot. As usual, a dark translucent BOOST sole provides the ultimate cushioning experience that keeps Yeezy fans coming back for more.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Pepper released in September of 2020 and retailed for $230.

Yeezy added a new colorway to their expanding 380 line with the Yeezy 380 Calcite Glow, now available on StockX. While 380 releases following the Alien colorway are known for their brown, earth-toned look, the Calcite returned to the design’s roots with a ghostly vibe just in time for Halloween.

The Yeezy 380 Calcite Glow is reminiscent of the very first Yeezy 380 release, the Yeezy 380 Alien. Similar to the Alien, the Calcite Glow features a white and grey perforated Primeknit upper. The main difference between the two colorways is that the Calcite Glow primarily features white throughout, with grey detailing. Also, the Calcite comes with a translucent, glow-in-the-dark sole that is guaranteed to add some extra glow to your feet.

The Yeezy 380 Calcite Glow released in October of 2020 and retailed for $250.

Yeezy applied the pressure during the 2020 holiday season and released another 380 colorway with the Yeezy Boost 380 Lmnte. This release follows Yeezy’s reputation of earth-toned colorways, balancing dark and light tones throughout the silhouette, similar to the look of fallen leaves on the forest floor.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Lmnte is composed of a tonal brown camo-print Primeknit upper with a golden spot on the lateral foot. A dark grey translucent Boost midsole, golden yellow outsole, and rope laces channel hiking boot vibes, while retaining the comfortable runner identity that the 380 is known for.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Lmnte released in December of 2020 and retailed for $230.

details.colorway: Alien Blue RF/Alien Blue RF/Alien Blue RF
details.description:
The adidas Yeezy 380 Alien Blue arrives in a light grey and white reflective Primeknit upper with a Glow Green side stripe. From there, a faint Alien Blue translucent BOOST sole provides a supportive base.

The adidas Yeezy 380 Alien Blue released in May of 2021 and retailed for $230.

Yeezy has introduced a new silhouette to their product line with the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Alien, now available on StockX. This model was originally known to be the Yeezy Boost 350 V3, but upon release it was given its own name.

This 380 Alien features a never before seen Primeknit pattern on its upper and lacks the traditional lateral side strip. An upgraded thicker Boost midsole and engineered outsole grip complete the design. These sneakers released in November of 2019 and retailed for $230.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Hylte Glow Reflective was part of a shock drop by the German brand and American musician Kanye West.

Made using semi-perforated Primeknit material on the upper with a monofilament strip on the lateral side, this Yeezy Boost 380 model has a Boost material interior sole for cushioning.The outer sole is made with rubber and herringbone traction on the bottom. The color palette combines shades of beige, white, grey and a light Hylte  green that reflects light.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Hylte Glow Reflective was originally released on the 11th of December 2020, at a retail price of $250.

The upper of the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pyrite is constructed of tonal grey camo Primeknit with perforations on each lateral side. At the base, a white semi-translucent Boost midsole provides structure and support for the woven design.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pyrite released in October of 2021 and retailed for $230.

details.colorway: Alien Blue RF/Alien Blue RF/Alien Blue RF

details.description:
The upper of the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pyrite is constructed of tonal grey camo Primeknit with perforations on each lateral side. At the base, a white semi-translucent Boost midsole provides structure and support for the woven design.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pyrite released in October of 2021 and retailed for $230.

Yeezy added a new colorway to their Boost 380 product line with the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Mist, now available on StockX. This model was originally known to be the Yeezy Boost 350 V3, but upon release it was given its own silhouette name. The mist colorway released in both reflective and non-reflective variations.

This 380 Mist features a Mist Primeknit pattern on its upper and lacks the traditional lateral side stripe. An upgraded translucent Boost midsole and engineered gum outsole grip complete the design. These sneakers released in March of 2020 and retailed for $230.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Azure was a collaboration between the Yeezy collection, designed with rapper Kanye West, and adidas.

The Yeezy Boost 380 features a PrimeKnit upper in various shades of blue with a stripe pattern that blends into the midsole. The midsole is made using Boost technology. The laces of the Yeezy Boost 380 are designed with each lace thread running through multiple eyelets, and the outsole is made of durable rubber to provide traction on a wide range of surfaces.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Azure was released on December 12, 2020, at a retail price of $230.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pepper Reflective is part of the original Yeezy Boost 380 line created by adidas in collaboration with Kanye West.

The Pepper adidas Yeezy Boost 380 has an upper that is constructed from premium materials to provide durability. The Primeknit textile used on the upper is both breathable and stretchable to mold to the foot. The sneaker features reflective detailing and comes in a Pepper colorway with beige laces. The sneaker is also equipped with adidas' signature Boost technology and has a gum-like translucent rubber outsole with a herringbone pattern.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Pepper Reflective was released on September 11, 2020 at a retail price of $250.

Yeezy added a new colorway to their Boost 380 product line with the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Bloarf, now available on StockX. This model was originally known to be the Yeezy Boost 350 V3, but upon release it was given its own silhouette name.

This 380 Bloarf features a Bloarf Primeknit pattern on its upper with a fitted ankle collar. An upgraded translucent Boost midsole and engineered gum outsole grip completes the design. These sneakers released in Spring of 2020 and retailed for $230.

Yeezy added to their glow-in-the-dark catalog by releasing a new colorway of the 380 with the Yeezy Boost 380 Hylte Glow. This is the second time in 2020 that Yeezy added glow-in-the-dark attributes to a 380, the first being the Yeezy Boost 380 Calcite that was released earlier in the fall.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Hylte Glow features a tonal yellow camo-print Primeknit upper with a flat neon green side spot. In typical Yeezy fashion, a dark grey translucent Boost sole and rope laces gear this release for daily wear.

The Yeezy Boost 380 Hylte Glow released in December of 2020 and retailed for $230.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Onyx Reflective is a part of the adidas Yeezy Boost series, designed in collaboration between adidas and very notable figure, Kanye West.

The Yeezy adidas Boost 380 Onyx Reflective upper is composed of a semi-translucent woven material and is engineered using Primeknit technology for flexibility. The shoe features reflective detailing and has a rubber sole that is made from adidas' patented Boost technology. The sneaker is designed with an onyx colorway and black and round races. The shoe also features a sock-like fit, with a distinctive pattern throughout the upper.

The adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Onyx Reflective were released on November 27, 2020 at a retail price of $250.

Yeezy added a new colorway to their Boost 380 product line with the adidas Yeezy Boost 380 Mist Reflective, now available on StockX. This model was originally known to be the Yeezy Boost 350 V3, but upon release it was given its own silhouette name. The mist colorway released in both reflective and non-reflective variations.

This 380 Mist Reflective features a reflective Mist Primeknit pattern on its upper and lacks the traditional lateral side stripe. An upgraded translucent Boost midsole and engineered gum outsole grip complete the design. These sneakers released in February of 2020 and retailed for $250.
